content.text:
<file path="server/src/handlers/increment_counter.ts">
import { db } from '../db';
import { countersTable } from '../db/schema';
import { type IncrementCounterInput, type Counter } from '../schema';
import { sql } from 'drizzle-orm';

export const incrementCounter = async (input: IncrementCounterInput): Promise<Counter> => {
  try {
    // Try to increment existing counter first
    const result = await db
      .update(countersTable)
      .set({
        count: sql`${countersTable.count} + ${input.increment}`,
        updated_at: new Date()
      })
      .returning()
      .execute();

    // If no counter exists, create one
    if (result.length === 0) {
      const newResult = await db
        .insert(countersTable)
        .values({
          count: input.increment,
          updated_at: new Date()
        })
        .returning()
        .execute();

      return newResult[0];
    }

    return result[0];
  } catch (error) {
    console.error('Counter increment failed:', error);
    throw error;
  }
};
</file>

<file path="server/src/tests/increment_counter.test.ts">
import { afterEach, beforeEach, describe, expect, it } from 'bun:test';
import { resetDB, createDB } from '../helpers';
import { db } from '../db';
import { countersTable } from '../db/schema';
import { type IncrementCounterInput } from '../schema';
import { incrementCounter } from '../handlers/increment_counter';
import { eq } from 'drizzle-orm';

describe('incrementCounter', () => {
  beforeEach(createDB);
  afterEach(resetDB);

  it('should create new counter when none exists', async () => {
    const input: IncrementCounterInput = { increment: 5 };
    const result = await incrementCounter(input);

    expect(result.id).toBeDefined();
    expect(result.count).toEqual(5);
    expect(result.updated_at).toBeInstanceOf(Date);
  });

  it('should use default increment of 1', async () => {
    const input: IncrementCounterInput = {};
    const result = await incrementCounter(input);

    expect(result.count).toEqual(1);
  });

  it('should increment existing counter', async () => {
    // Create initial counter
    await db.insert(countersTable)
      .values({ count: 10, updated_at: new Date() })
      .execute();

    const input: IncrementCounterInput = { increment: 3 };
    const result = await incrementCounter(input);

    expect(result.count).toEqual(13);
    expect(result.updated_at).toBeInstanceOf(Date);
  });

  it('should save counter to database', async () => {
    const input: IncrementCounterInput = { increment: 7 };
    const result = await incrementCounter(input);

    const counters = await db.select()
      .from(countersTable)
      .where(eq(countersTable.id, result.id))
      .execute();

    expect(counters).toHaveLength(1);
    expect(counters[0].count).toEqual(7);
    expect(counters[0].updated_at).toBeInstanceOf(Date);
  });

  it('should handle multiple increments correctly', async () => {
    // First increment
    await incrementCounter({ increment: 5 });
    
    // Second increment
    const result = await incrementCounter({ increment: 3 });

    expect(result.count).toEqual(8);
  });
});
</file>

<file path="server/src/handlers/get_counter.ts">
import { db } from '../db';
import { countersTable } from '../db/schema';
import { type Counter } from '../schema';

export async function getCounter(): Promise<Counter> {
  try {
    // Try to get existing counter
    const result = await db.select()
      .from(countersTable)
      .limit(1)
      .execute();

    // If counter exists, return it
    if (result.length > 0) {
      return result[0];
    }

    // If no counter exists, create one with initial value 0
    const newCounterResult = await db.insert(countersTable)
      .values({
        count: 0
      })
      .returning()
      .execute();

    return newCounterResult[0];
  } catch (error) {
    console.error('Failed to get counter:', error);
    throw error;
  }
}
</file>

<file path="server/src/tests/get_counter.test.ts">
import { afterEach, beforeEach, describe, expect, it } from 'bun:test';
import { resetDB, createDB } from '../helpers';
import { db } from '../db';
import { countersTable } from '../db/schema';
import { getCounter } from '../handlers/get_counter';

describe('getCounter', () => {
  beforeEach(createDB);
  afterEach(resetDB);

  it('should create and return a new counter when none exists', async () => {
    const result = await getCounter();

    expect(result.id).toBeDefined();
    expect(result.count).toEqual(0);
    expect(result.updated_at).toBeInstanceOf(Date);
  });

  it('should return existing counter when one exists', async () => {
    // Create a counter first
    await db.insert(countersTable)
      .values({ count: 42 })
      .execute();

    const result = await getCounter();

    expect(result.count).toEqual(42);
    expect(result.id).toBeDefined();
    expect(result.updated_at).toBeInstanceOf(Date);
  });

  it('should save new counter to database', async () => {
    await getCounter();

    // Verify counter was saved to database
    const counters = await db.select()
      .from(countersTable)
      .execute();

    expect(counters).toHaveLength(1);
    expect(counters[0].count).toEqual(0);
    expect(counters[0].updated_at).toBeInstanceOf(Date);
  });

  it('should return the first counter when multiple exist', async () => {
    // Create multiple counters
    await db.insert(countersTable)
      .values([
        { count: 10 },
        { count: 20 }
      ])
      .execute();

    const result = await getCounter();

    // Should return one of the counters (likely the first one due to limit(1))
    expect([10, 20]).toContain(result.count);
    expect(result.id).toBeDefined();
    expect(result.updated_at).toBeInstanceOf(Date);
  });
});
</file>
I need to check the handler implementations to understand the exact return types and ensure proper integration.

Given original user request:
A simple web application with a single button. Each click on the button increments a counter. The counter value should be persisted in a database on the backend. The frontend should display the current count and the button. Technologies: Typescript, Drizzle, tRPC, React.
Implement solely the required changes according to the user feedback:

Modify the `client/src/App.tsx` file.
Below the increment button, add a small, fun message with emojis.
For example, a `div` element with text like "✨ Keep on clicking! ✨ Your clicks make a difference! 🎉".
Ensure it's styled subtly, maybe with a smaller font and a light gray color, similar to the existing `text-center text-xs text-gray-400` styling.
